thread.title: England come up against mighty figure of Rahkeem Cornwall
thread.title_full: England come up against mighty figure of Rahkeem Cornwall | Daily Mail Online

author: Adam Shergold for MailOnline
title: England come up against mighty figure of Rahkeem Cornwall
text:
England came up against the larger-than-life character of Rahkeem Cornwall when they took on the WICB President's XI in a one-day tour match in St Kitts on Monday.
It's fair to say that 24-year-old Cornwall does not immediately strike you as an elite athlete. A towering 6ft 5in tall and heftily built, the Antiguan all-rounder smacked 59 from just 61 balls in Basseterre.
Cornwall was on the roster of the Caribbean Premier League side Antigua Hawksbills until they pulled out of the competition and has been playing of late for the Leeward Islands in the regional Super 50 competition.
Rahkeem Cornwall bats for the WICB President's XI in their match with England on Monday
The larger-than-life Cornwall towers over his batting partner Jahmar Hamilton
24-year-old Antiguan Cornwall made 59 for the West Indies side at Basseterre, St Kitts
Cornwall swings his bat during his innings of 59 against England in Monday's tour match
In nine matches in that tournament, he scored 252 runs at an average of 50.40. His bowling averages have also been impressive, with an economy rate of 2.86 in first-class matches.
He caught the eye during a WICB President's XI match against India in July last year, taking five wickets, and the West Indies selectors certainly have him on their radar, even if he might have to tone up a bit.
Chairman of Selectors Courtney Browne said recently: 'We’re actually putting a programme in place for Rahkeem where we are actually going to have someone to manage him overall.
Cornwall impressed with his bowling when the same team against India last summer
India's Ajinkya Rahane watches Cornwall's bowling closely during the tour match last summer
'We are looking at the various components of him playing cricket where we are looking at coaches, dietitians, and just getting everybody to come together to help this young player because he’s a special talent.'
Before striking his 59 against England, the tourists were dealt a blow when Jake Ball limped out of the match after bowling just 2.1 overs.
Ball left the field after feeling pain in the back of his right knee and was withdrawn from the match to have scans on the injury.
It is the latest injury problem for England, who are already without opener Jason Roy, who suffered bruising to his right palm.
England were dealt a blow when Jake Ball went off having injured his knee
